reviews.review_msg: Great prof, don't bother with the textbook, go to class, take notes, get engaged with him and you'll do great. Boosted all our reports by one letter grade at the end because we all did well :)
She does not follow her assignment outlines.
She is an amazing professor. This course is a little hard and requires work but she makes it a lot easier.

Most of the work comes from the labs, so you gotta put in some effort to do well in those. The exams are split into two parts - individual and group. As much as I dislike group work, it actually boosts your grade for the most part. Lectures also involve group discussions so make sure you read the textbook beforehand or can focus well in class.
She talks to people like they are in highschool, material feels equally highschool.

Kirsten is one of the better profs that I've had at SFU. Her lectures are informative but the material is easy to grasp. She explains things well so pay attention! Study her notes, understand concepts, don't just memorize. With effort, there is no reason someone can't do well in this course.

Pointless busywork in meaningless lab exercises. Inadequate preparation to make these meaningful. Too much time in class explaining easy stuff (clouds) and not enough for the hard stuff (weather forecasts).

Extremely long and boring lectures, labs were very disorganized and not very useful. Quizzes, exams and midterms were easy to do since they were all online. If you are interested in the material and not only taking this course because you have to, I recommend you find another professor to teach it.

Labs were easy, I didn't have any Excel experience before either. The final wasn't too difficult, familiarize yourself with the lectures. The lectures are a little long, and the slide decks are very long albeit detailed. He's straightforward to talk to so if you have any doubts, clarify with him.

Wolf was honestly great and a pretty cool guy too. There are a few recorded lectures to watch outside of class but they're not that long (1ish hr extra per week). Easy material if you study. You can't really go into a climatology class not expecting there to be any physics involved lol. Labs are incredibly easy and u have three attempts. Nice dude

Wolf struggled with the transition to online, but seems to be a decent prof otherwise. Lectures in a weird order (each had numbers but weren't taught in order). At end of the term assigned lots of lectures to watch outside of class because he ran out of time. The labs/tests were easy, but the class was pretty time consuming due to disorganization.
He is a very nice person, and very chill to talk to. The assignments aren't hard and he isn't a hard marker. But his lecture is usually long and makes you wanna fall asleep.

Wolf is actually a good prof. He is really passionate about the material. Midterm and finals are doable and fair. Labs are easy since he gave us the template. Lecture is boring but very informative. The TA (nesha) is super nice too. Maybe he changed the syllabus for 214 which made it much easier (based on previous review bout him).

Probably not the best lecturer I've ever had. He seems passionate about his work but has a monotone voice which made the classes boring. The labs were more interesting as very Excel heavy (all reports are done using excel). His tests were fair but recommend that you actually study. There is a textbook but relied more on the lecture slides.

Tests are easy, study the night before and you're good. Takes forever to mark things. Puts an unnecessary amount of effort into the class, which I appreciate. The labs are absolutely brutal. The first one took me 8 hours to complete. It's not hard, but the lab instructions were unclear and didn't make sense, and he just gave it to you to figure out
Midterm is easy. Only takes me 20 min to finish a 2-hour midterm.

Wolf is passionate and knowledgable. His lectures are detailed and informative, and will answer questions clearly. However, he doesn't know how to use powerpoint transitions which causes his lectures to have 150+ slides. Labs are worth 5% each, but you can spend hours doing them because he won't get to the point on what you're supposed to do.

Yes, he was a bit hard to understand but overall he taught well. I didn't find anything difficult to understand by just reading his notes and referring to text. Overall, he's a good prof just hard to understand just had to pay close attention to the lecture.

Jax is a very nice and helpful proff. He genuinely wants you to do well in his class.  His English is great but yes, he does have an accent and it?s a little hard to understand at first but you get used to it.  His exam are all lecture based so you do need to attend class.  Exams are not easy but not hard because he provides a study guide that is v
Unbelievable, I could not understand a word the guy was saying. Very incomprehensible with a heavy accent.  Has a mean attitude. Shouldnt have been hired.
Second best professor I've ever had.
Nice guy, was always willing to help you. Easy assignments but difficult exams. TA sucked though
absolute worst prof i have ever had. his teaching is terrible and exams are extremely hard. DO NOT TAKE TAKE THIS COURSE WITH HIM!
